name: Imagery feature types
definition: The Imagery Foundation Theme is a suite of continuously updated georeferenced spaceborne, airborne and terrestrial imagery, as well as any novel sources, for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. The Foundation Theme makes imagery with different resolutions available nationally to multiple users for a wide range of missions such as national security, natural resource management and urban development.

concepts.name: Oblique Airborne Image
concepts.definition: Image of the Earth surface intentionally captured at a very high offpointing angle for specific applications from aircraft (plane, UAV, helicopter etc.).

concepts.name: Vertical Airborne Image
concepts.definition: Raster image of the Earth surface captured close to nadir using aircraft (plane, UAV, helicopter etc.).

concepts.name: Spaceborne Image
concepts.definition: Raster image of the Earth surface that was acquired using spaceborne platform (e.g. satellite).

concepts.name: Aggregated Mosaic Element
concepts.definition: Mosaic element relating to several input images that share the same acquisition time at a given level of definition (e.g. day, month). The geometry of an aggregated mosaic element corresponds to the union of the contributing areas, in the mosaic, of several input images.

concepts.name: Image
concepts.definition: Raster image that can depict Earth surface seen from above or elements other than Earth surface seen from above, for example, facades of the buildings) that has not been geometrically corrected ("orthorectified").

concepts.name: Mosaic Element
concepts.definition: Abstract type identifying both the contributing area and the acquisition time of one or several input images used to generate a mosaiced orthoimage coverage. The main purpose of this Feature Type is the provision of a mechanism for describing the spatial distribution of the acquisition dates and times over a mosaiced orthoimage. The acquisition time can be supplied either for each individual input image, or for sets of input images grouped together according to temporal criteria.

concepts.name: Ortho Image
concepts.definition: Georeferenced raster image of the Earth surface that has been geometrically corrected ("orthorectified") to remove distortion caused by differences in elevation, sensor tilt and, optionally, by sensor optics. An orthoimage coverage is a continuous coverage based on a rectified quadrilateral grid. It is provided with an interpolation method to evaluate value records at any direct position within its domain. It can be derived from one single input image or from different input images which have been mosaiced and merged together. An orthoimage coverage may be an aggregation of subsets extracted from other orthoimage coverages. For the avoidance of data duplication, this kind of aggregated orthoimage is dynamically constructed by references to the contributing orthoimage coverages.

concepts.name: Photogrammetric Control Point
concepts.definition: Point identified in the terrain or other structure (e.g. building facade) used for georeferencing an image.

concepts.name: Single Mosaic Element
concepts.definition: Mosaic element relating to a single input image which corresponds exactly to the contributing area, in the mosaic, of the single input image.

concepts.name: Abstract Terrestrial Image
concepts.definition: Abstract class that contains elements common for raster datasets used in terrestrial imagery. Specializations of this class are TerrestrialImage, DepthMap and SegmentationMap.

concepts.name: Depth Map
concepts.definition: Raster dataset representing distance between camera and specific spatial elements in the image. This type of dataset can be derived from LIDAR.

concepts.name: Segmentation Map
concepts.definition: Raster dataset representing segmented elements of the image. This type of dataset can be derived from LIDAR.

concepts.name: Terrestrial Image
concepts.definition: Raster image that can depict elements other than Earth surface seen from above.
